skill.name: techdoc-search-and-orchestrate
skill.description: Delegates technical documentation queries to the context7-researcher agent. Prevents token pollution in main conversation context by routing all library and framework documentation requests through a specialized agent that uses Context7 MCP for accurate, up-to-date technical documentation retrieval.
skill.summary: Orchestrates technical documentation queries through a dedicated agent to maintain clean conversation context and optimize token usage.

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill is a pure orchestration layer that delegates to another agent using Task tool. No network calls, file operations, or command execution occur. Static scanner misidentified markdown code fences as shell backticks and UTF-8 Chinese text as encrypted content.

content.value_statement: Technical documentation queries often clutter conversation context with large text blocks. This skill routes all documentation requests to a specialized agent, keeping your main conversation clean and token-efficient while ensuring accurate, context-aware responses.
actual_capabilities: Detects when user needs technical documentation for libraries or frameworks
Delegates documentation queries to context7-researcher agent via Task tool
Orchestrates multiple parallel documentation queries for independent topics
Sequentially executes dependent queries where answers require prior context
Maintains clean main conversation by isolating documentation retrieval
limitations: Requires Context7 MCP server to be available and configured
Cannot answer questions about proprietary or non-indexed documentation
Does not provide real-time updates to documentation content
Relies on the context7-researcher agent for actual document retrieval

use_cases.title: Library API Reference Lookup
use_cases.description: Quickly retrieve API documentation for libraries like Supabase, Next.js, or Express without clogging your conversation with documentation text.
use_cases.target_user: Developers building applications who need accurate API references

use_cases.title: Multi-Framework Comparison
use_cases.description: Compare documentation across multiple frameworks or versions side by side by running parallel queries for independent topics.

use_cases.title: Error Resolution Research
use_cases.description: Debug errors by first researching the root cause, then finding solutions based on that context - all handled through sequential agent orchestration.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Documentation Query
prompt_templates.prompt: Query the documentation for {library_or_framework} to find information about {specific_feature_or_api}.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a specific piece of information from a library's docs

prompt_templates.title: Code Example Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Find code examples in {library_name} documentation showing how to {specific_task}.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need practical implementation examples

prompt_templates.title: Parallel Documentation Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Run parallel queries to research: 1) {topic_1} from {library_a} docs, 2) {topic_2} from {library_b} docs, 3) {topic_3} from {library_c} docs. Present findings side by side for comparison.
prompt_templates.scenario: When comparing features across multiple libraries simultaneously

prompt_templates.title: Sequential Debugging Research
prompt_templates.prompt: First query {library} documentation to understand {error_component}, then use that context to find how to {solution_pattern}. Explain the relationship between the error and the solution.
prompt_templates.scenario: When troubleshooting errors where understanding requires layered research

output_examples.input: How do I set up authentication with Supabase?
output: Supabase provides multiple authentication methods. The recommended approach uses their JS SDK with the following pattern:
1. Initialize the client with your project URL and anon key
2. Use the auth object to sign users in with email/password or OAuth providers
3. Protect routes by checking auth state on the client and server

output_examples.input: What are the differences between Next.js App Router and Pages Router?
output: Key differences between App Router and Pages Router:
- App Router uses React Server Components by default, reducing client bundle size
- App Router introduces a new file-system based routing with layout.js and page.js
- Data fetching in App Router uses async/await in components without useEffect
- Server Actions provide a native way to handle form submissions

output_examples.input: Compare Prisma and Drizzle ORMs for my Next.js project
output: Both Prisma and Drizzle are popular ORM choices for Next.js with different philosophies:
- Developer experience with auto-generated types and intuitive API
- Higher-level abstraction with built-in migration system
- Slightly heavier runtime due to query engine
- Lightweight, SQL-like syntax close to raw queries
- No runtime overhead, generates minimal SQL
- More control but requires understanding of SQL concepts
Recommendation: Prisma for rapid development, Drizzle for performance-critical applications.

best_practices: Break down broad documentation queries into specific topics to enable parallel execution
Use sequential queries only when answers are genuinely dependent on prior results
Let the orchestration skill handle the agent delegation rather than calling Context7 MCP directly
anti_patterns: Making multiple unrelated documentation queries in a single prompt instead of parallel agents
Calling context7-researcher directly from main conversation instead of routing through this skill
Querying proprietary or paid documentation that Context7 MCP cannot access

faq.question: Why should I use this skill instead of calling Context7 MCP directly?
faq.answer: This skill prevents documentation text from polluting your main conversation context. It orchestrates queries efficiently and keeps your conversation history clean and token-efficient.

faq.question: What is Context7 MCP?
faq.answer: Context7 MCP is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to up-to-date technical documentation for popular libraries and frameworks through a standardized interface.

faq.question: When should I use parallel vs sequential execution?
faq.answer: Use parallel execution when queries are independent. Use sequential execution only when you need the answer from one query to formulate the next query, such as error debugging scenarios.

faq.question: What libraries and frameworks does Context7 support?
faq.answer: Context7 supports major open source libraries and frameworks. Check the Context7 MCP documentation for the current list of supported libraries and their documentation versions.

faq.question: Can this skill handle real-time documentation updates?
faq.answer: This skill retrieves documentation from Context7 MCP's indexed content. While the content is regularly updated, it may not reflect the very latest commits or release candidates.

faq.question: Does this skill require any additional configuration?
faq.answer: Yes, the Context7 MCP server must be configured and available in your environment for this skill to function correctly.
